DOCNAME: CASE OF OGRAZDEN AD AND OTHERS v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Administrative proceedings;Civil proceedings;Enforcement proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy)
JUDGES: Erik Møse;Julia Laffranque;Khanlar Hajiyev;Linos-Alexandre Sicilianos;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen
TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Instance ordered a certain Mr I.A. to pay a debt established in the first applicant ’s favour . On DATE the first - instance court stayed the enforcement proceedings since the debtor had died . The applicant did not appeal against this decision .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE , the first applicant lodged a length complaint with ORG . On DATE the court established that the enforcement proceedings , at that moment , had been pending for DATE before the first - instance court and had not yet ended . The court found that there was a violation of the first applicant ’s right to a hearing within a reasonable time . It set a DATE time - limit for the first - instance court to bring the enforcement proceedings to a conclusion and awarded the first applicant the equivalent of MONEY ( ORG ) by way of just satisfaction . In the absence of an appeal , this decision became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant sought that ORG ( “ the Fund ” ) recognise her right to a disability pension . After several remittals ordered by ORG and ORG , on DATE the ORG accepted the second applicant ’s request and acknowledged her right to a disability pension .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE , the second applicant complained to ORG that the administrative proceedings had lasted too long and requested compensation . On DATE ORG established that the impugned proceedings , at that time , had lasted for over DATE and awarded her the equivalent of ORG CARDINAL by way of just satisfaction . On DATE the second - instance panel of ORG allowed the second applicant ’s appeal and awarded her a higher compensation , the equivalent of which was EUR CARDINAL . This sum was paid on DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the third applicant requested annulment of her dismissal . On DATE ORG overturned the lower court ’s decision and dismissed her claim . On DATE ORG dismissed on the merits the third applicant ’s appeal on points of law ( ревизија ) .

CARDINAL . In the meantime , on DATE , the third applicant complained to ORG about the length of the labour proceedings . On DATE ORG rejected ( отфрла ) her claim as having been submitted outside the statutory DATE time - limit , which , in her case , started to run on DATE . The second - instance panel of ORG confirmed this decision .
